data.text: @paintoolkit2 On the webpage is mentioned that "some" keep on experiencing symptoms after covid-19. 10-20%, who get long COVID based on literature, is globally quite a big number... Is there a source for the statement "all should get better"...no, there isn't unfortunately.

@BreathewellPT @OnTapPhysio @paintoolkit2 Awfully strange, ain’t it?

I’d like to believe there’s some good in this, but I’m having a hard time wrapping my head this miraculous new way to manage #LongCovid 

I’m two years in with organ damage, neurological dysfunction and check the #MECFS box too.

Will it help? 🤔

@OnTapPhysio @paintoolkit2 I’m not seeing any reference to the uniqueness of post viral illness and LC (PEM/PESE); nor any reference to ME/CFS (which provides an abundance of self management strategies for LC).  LC is not like chronic pain; pls don’t repackage pain management for LC;they are not the same.

@paintoolkit2 Can you provide evidence that #LongCovid symptoms should get better over time? Given that we do not yet know the pathophysiology of LC, this is quite a statement. And, we have the lived experiences of many people that do no agree with this.
